DOC.brief_summary: A prospective , multi-center , double blind , 2 stage , placebo-controlled , phase II study , evaluate acute intra-coronary injected collagenase prior routine standard-of-care percutaneous revascularization procedure subject chronic total coronary artery occlusion ( CTOs ) .
DOC.criteria: Male female patient > 18 year age clinically driven , plan PCI target CTO , major epicardial coronary artery , without plan revascularization coronary stenosis/stenoses major epicardial segment . Target CTO must great equal 3 calendar month prior Screening Target CTO must meet protocol define criterion entry Patient receive course optimal antiischemic medical therapy ( least 2 antianginal agent maximum tolerated antianginal therapy ) Documented chest radiation exposure > 4.0 Gray within 8 week Day 0 Target vessel occlude stent , saphenous vein graft Patient ACS < 4 week Screening , attributable coronary vessel Patient nonhealed dissection plane extend point adjacent coronary lumen distal target CTO Patient know suspect target vessel perforation within 30 day Day 0 Angiographic exclusion criterion define protocol
